summary: w3c_indexeddb.js externs: keyPath parameter in createIndex could be string or array

comments.content: According to the specification http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/#widl-IDBObjectStore-createIndex-IDBIndex-DOMString-name-any-keyPath-IDBIndexParameters-optionalParameters keyPath parameter in createIndex could be string or array What steps will reproduce the problem? In https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/externs/w3c_indexeddb.js /** * @param {string} name The name of the index. * @param {string} keyPath The path to the index key. * @param {Object=} opt_paramters Optional parameters * for the created index. * @return {!IDBIndex} The IDBIndex object. */ IDBObjectStore.prototype.createIndex = function(name, keyPath, opt_paramters) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? /** * @param {string} name The name of the index. * @param {string|!Array.<string>} keyPath The path to the index key. * @param {Object=} opt_paramters Optional parameters * for the created index. * @return {!IDBIndex} The IDBIndex object. */ IDBObjectStore.prototype.createIndex = function(name, keyPath, opt_paramters) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Please provide any additional information below.
